data.description:
**Company Description**
  
Najah Malhuz is where bold ideas meet digital transformation, amplifying your brand’s voice and boosting engagement. Specializing in e-commerce, Social Media Marketing, SEO, Graphic Design, and Web Development, we drive impactful results. Our innovative approach captivates and delivers, pushing boundaries to elevate brands to new heights. Najah Malhuz is your trusted partner in the digital frontier, ready to transform and redefine your digital presence.
  
  
**Role Description**
  
This is a full-time remote role for an Article Writer. The Article Writer will be responsible for creating, editing, and optimizing articles for various digital platforms. Daily tasks include conducting research, developing content ideas, writing clear and engaging articles, and collaborating with the marketing team to ensure alignment with brand strategy. The role also involves proofreading, SEO optimization, and staying updated with industry trends.
  
  
**Qualifications**
  

- Exceptional Writing, Editing, and Proofreading skills
- Experience in SEO and Content Optimization
- Ability to conduct thorough Research and develop Content Strategies
- Understanding of Social Media Marketing and Digital Platforms
- Excellent communication skills and the ability to work independently and remotely
- Experience in Graphic Design and Web Development is a plus
- Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Communications, or a related field

Application Deadline
  
  
31 October 2025
  
  
**About Us**
**Korn Ferry**
is a global consulting firm that powers performance. We unlock the potential in your people and unleash transformation across your business—synchronizing strategy, operations, and talent to accelerate performance, fuel growth, and inspire a legacy of change. That’s why the world’s most forward-thinking companies across every major industry turn to us—for a shared commitment to lasting impact and the bold ambition to
*Be More Than.*
Korn Ferry Digital Is a Scaled Product Business Unit Within Korn Ferry That Develops And Sells Our Suite Of Talent Products And HR Technology, Supporting Clients Across Six Solution Areas
  
  

- Organizational Strategy
- Assessment and Succession
- Talent Acquisition
- Leadership and Professional Development
- Sales and Service
- Total Rewards

**Job Description**
**OPPORTUNITY TO ENHANCE YOUR CAREER -**
It’s about exceeding your potential.
  
  
We’re looking for a hands-on, scrappy growth marketer to build our demand generation engine from the ground up. This isn’t a “manage the agency” role. You’ll be writing copy, launching campaigns, and optimizing in-platform performance while also shaping the growth strategy. The ideal candidate thrives on data-driven decision-making and brings hands-on experience with vibe marketing, leveraging AI to create and scale campaigns while driving content creation, optimization, and growth at speed.
  
  
If you thrive in a fast-moving environment, love testing and iterating, and know how to turn limited resources into outsized results, this role is for you.
  
  
**WHY THIS ROLE IS EXCITING**

- Build from scratch: Design and scale a demand engine that doesn’t exist today, shaping the playbook, tools, and channels.
- Direct impact on revenue: Success is measured by contribution to pipeline and closed-won revenue, not vanity metrics.
- Full-funnel and lifecycle ownership: Run programs across the funnel from awareness to retention while knowing where to focus for the greatest impact. Partner with Korn Ferry’s Corporate Brand team to convert top-of-funnel activity into mid- and bottom-of-funnel opportunities.
- Analytics and AI: Combine analytical rigor with vibe marketing. Use AI to scale campaigns, free up time for creative direction, and deliver marketing that both performs and resonates.
- Hands-on and fast-moving: Write copy, launch campaigns, and pull reports yourself, learning fast and scaling what works.
- High visibility: Work directly with sales, product marketing, product, engineering, and leadership to shape how we go to market and grow.
- Room to innovate: Test new ideas, apply AI to scale programs, and bring creative growth tactics that cut through.

**Key Responsibilities**

- Collaborate with stakeholders to leverage market research and customer data to define audience personas, segmentation criteria, and messaging strategies.
- Build and run campaigns end to end, from ads and landing page copy to nurtures and reporting.
- Partner with sales, product marketing, and product teams to define segments, craft messaging, and align on growth and pipeline goals.
- Be a full-funnel and lifecycle marketer, designing programs that span awareness, demand, nurture, retention, and expansion while focusing resources where they will move the needle most.
- Manage and optimize paid channels such as Google, LinkedIn, syndication, social, and niche publishers through continuous testing.
- Continuously evaluate and refine channel mix based on performance data to maximize ROI and pipeline contribution.
- Perform detailed keyword research to identify high-traffic, relevant keywords and build paid search strategies.
- Create high-impact campaign assets including landing pages, ads, emails, nurture tracks, and sales enablement tools.
- Build nurture programs that convert interest into qualified opportunities and accelerate deals.
- Own reporting on marketing-sourced and influenced pipeline, with a focus on CAC, CPL, ROAS, velocity, and lifetime value.
- Run growth experiments using structured frameworks such as sprints and A/B testing to validate hypotheses quickly and scale proven tactics.
- Apply vibe marketing principles, using AI to handle execution such as content creation, optimization, and workflows while you focus on creative direction and emotional resonance.
- Leverage the MarTech stack (Marketo, Salesforce, 6sense, enrichment tools) to keep execution lean and effective.
- Test, learn, and iterate quickly, prioritizing speed to impact over perfection.

**Professional Experience/Qualifications**

- 8+ years of B2B marketing experience, with proven success in growth and performance marketing.
- Comfortable being both strategist and executor. You set the plan and build the campaign.
- Demonstrated ability to drive revenue growth in resource-constrained environments.
- Hands-on expertise with SEM, paid social, email nurture, and digital campaigns.
- Strong copywriting skills across ads, landing pages, and email.
- Experience developing a content marketing strategy, project managing the content process, creating content directly, and building the workflows and campaigns to activate it.
- Analytical mindset, skilled at pulling data, analyzing performance, and making quick decisions.
- Hands-on experience with Marketo, Salesforce, 6sense, and related MarTech tools.
- Proven track record applying growth frameworks such as weekly sprints, A/B testing, and structured experimentation.
- Experience collaborating with product and engineering teams to build scalable growth systems.
- Ability to apply vibe marketing, blending AI-driven execution with human creativity to create campaigns that are fast, scalable, and emotionally resonant.
- Full-funnel mindset. You understand how awareness, demand creation, nurturing, retention, and sales enablement fit together, and you know how to flex resources where impact is greatest.
- A builder’s mindset: scrappy, creative, and unafraid to get into the weeds.

**EDUCATION**

- Bachelor’s degree in related field highly preferred.

Salary Range
  
  
$85,000.00 - $110,000.00
  
  
*Salary range represents the compensation Korn Ferry expects to pay to a candidate with the requirements for the job posted. Korn Ferry offers competitive compensation and benefits commensurate with experience.*
****Korn Ferry Benefits****
*The Korn Ferry Cares Wellbeing Platform offers Employees health benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, Short Term Disability, Basic Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment), Critical Illness, Accident Injury, Hospital Indemnity, and Legal Insurance. Employees are eligible to enroll in Korn Ferry's Tax Deferred Savings plan 401(k). Employee Stock Purchase Program is available to all permanent employees who work 20 hours or more after 6 months of service.*
*Employees are eligible to receive a total of 15 days vacation annually plus paid time off for 16 company holidays. Full time eligible employees will accrue sick time commencing on the first date of employment at the rate of 3.33 hours per pay period for an annualized maximum of 80 hours.*
***Internal Mobility at Korn Ferry***
*If you currently work for Korn Ferry or one of our affiliates, you must be eligible to apply for a different position within Korn Ferry to use the Careers Site. If you accept such a position, your benefits programs and Human Resources policies may change. Please consult with your HR contact for the new position concerning application eligibility, including any immigration/visa needs, benefit programs, and HR policies applicable to that position.*
**Korn Ferry is an Equal Employment Opportunity**
**Employer**
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

company_object.name: Korn Ferry
company_object.long_description: Korn Ferry is a global organizational consulting firm, bringing together strategy and talent to drive superior performance for our clients. We work with clients to design their organizational structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people and advise them on how to reward, develop, and motivate their workforce. And we help professionals navigate and advance their careers.
company_object.seo_description: In 2015 Korn Ferry acquired Hay Group, diversifying its offering and adding talent management consulting to its portfolio of services.

data.description:
A global biopharmaceutical organization is seeking a
**Computer System Validation (CSV) Engineer**
to support the implementation and validation of enterprise lab systems, with a primary focus on LIMS and chromatography data systems. This role is embedded within the
**OT**
Labs team and will be instrumental in executing the full system development lifecycle—from requirements gathering through validation summary reporting.
  
  
This position is onsite, with remote work limited to 1 day per week. Travel may be required occasionally between local sites.
  
  
**Responsibilities for the CSV Engineer include:**
System Lifecycle Execution:
  
  

- Lead and support validation activities for LIMS and chromatography systems.
- Manage end-to-end system development lifecycle: requirements development, installation qualification (IQ), operational qualification (OQ), performance qualification (PQ), and validation summary reporting.
- Establish and document workflows for computerized instrumentation.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:
  
  

- Work closely with embedded CSV team members and OT Labs stakeholders.
- Interface with QA, QC, Microbiology, MSAT, and IOT groups to ensure validation alignment.
- Support execution and documentation of validation deliverables.

Enterprise System Support:
  
  

- Contribute to validation efforts for other enterprise systems such as ERP, QMS, and MES.
- Ensure compliance with regulatory standards and internal quality procedures.
- Participate in continuous improvement initiatives related to lab system validation.

**Requirements for the CSV Engineer include:**

- Minimum 5 years of experience in CSV/CSA within a regulated lab or manufacturing environment.
- Hands-on experience with LIMS, ERP, QMS, or MES implementation and validation
- Familiarity with Waters Empower or similar chromatography systems.
- Strong understanding of computerized system lifecycle and validation documentation.
- Ability to work independently and collaboratively across technical teams.
- Excellent organizational and communication skills.

**Compensation for the CSV Engineer includes:**

- Hourly Rate: $65-$70/hr (higher rates may be considered for exceptional candidates)
- Benefits: Health, Dental, Vision, PTO, Holiday's, and sick leave required by law

Keywords:
  
  
CSV Engineer, LIMS Validation, Chromatography Systems, Empower, Waters, CSA, Computerized System Lifecycle, IQ/OQ/PQ, Enterprise System Validation, ERP, QMS, MES, GMP Compliance, Lab Informatics
  
  
Application Start Date: September 12, 2025
  
  
Application Window: Open for a minimum of 30 days from posting

company_object.name: Piper Companies
company_object.long_description:
Piper Companies is a professional services and consulting partner that operates three distinct divisional business units specializing in Health Sciences, Enterprise Information Technology and Cyber & Cloud Security.

Piper Health Sciences services the Life Sciences, Clinical Research, and Applied Health communities.  Focused on delivering results by teaming with our customers to build, integrate, and support mission-critical initiatives.  Piper regularly deploys top technical consultants and turnkey project solutions within highly regulated GxP environments, specifically within the Pharmaceutical, Biotechnology, Medical Device, and Consumer Goods industries. 

Piper Enterprise Information Technology services clientele including, but not limited to, Healthcare, Financial Services, Telecommunications, Technology Enablement, Entertainment & Gaming, Energy, Utilities, Transportation, Retail, and Insurance.

C2 Cyber & Cloud Security brings unparalleled expertise to the table, shaped by the founding and scaling of Crypsis, a leading Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) company.  Recognized by the world's largest cyber firms, we understand the intricacies of protecting critical infrastructure, securing networks, navigating cyber threats, managing cloud integrations, and identifying top-tier talent.

Piper Health Sciences 
•	Technical Operations and Manufacturing Sciences 
•	Quality and Regulatory Compliance
•	Project Management 
•	Commissioning, Qualification and Validation
•	Clinical Research Operations and Development
•	Applied Health  

Piper Enterprise Information Technology 
•	IT Infrastructure & Cloud  
•	Software Development  
•	Business Intelligence & Data Analytics  
•	Cyber and Information Security  
•	Business Analysis and Project Management

C2 Cyber & Cloud Security
•	Digital Forensics & Incident Response
•	Network Security
•	Security Operation
•	Security Architecting
•	Cloud Security
company_object.seo_description: Piper Companies offers consulting and professional services across Health Sciences, IT and Cyber & Cloud Security
